docs.lead_paragraph: America will continue to patrol the South China Sea to ensure freedom of navigation and overflight in the disputed region, a U.S. admiral said Friday amid questions whether U.S. involvement in one of Asia's potential flashpoints will change.

headline.main: US Admiral in Disputed South China Sea: 'We Will Be Here'
headline.print_headline: US Admiral in Disputed South China Sea: 'We Will Be Here'

docs.snippet: America will continue to patrol the South China Sea to ensure freedom of navigation and overflight in the disputed region, a U.S. admiral said Friday amid questions whether U.S. involvement in one of Asia's potential flashpoints will change....

docs.lead_paragraph: The 19-country eurozone economy is growing at its fastest rate since 2011, according to a survey released Friday, but few economists expect the European Central Bank to ease up on its stimulus efforts anytime soon given political uncertainties that could derail the recovery.

headline.main: Eurozone Growth Running at Fastest Rate Since 2011
headline.print_headline: Eurozone Growth Running at Fastest Rate Since 2011

docs.lead_paragraph: Samsung chief Jay Y. Lee has handpicked 13 top lawyers to defend him against charges of bribing the South Korean president, nearly all of them former judges or prosecutors, according to the court where one of the richest men in the country will be tried.

headline.main: Star-Studded Legal Team Will Seek to Save Samsung Chief
headline.print_headline: Star-Studded Legal Team Will Seek to Save Samsung Chief

docs.lead_paragraph: Activity in euro zone businesses grew at its quickest pace in nearly six years in February and job creation reached its fastest in almost a decade, driven by robust demand and exports, a survey found.

headline.main: Euro Zone February Business Growth Fastest in Nearly Six Years: PMI
headline.print_headline: Euro Zone February Business Growth Fastest in Nearly Six Years: PMI

docs.snippet: Activity in euro zone businesses grew at its quickest pace in nearly six years in February and job creation reached its fastest in almost a decade, driven by robust demand and exports, a survey found....

docs.lead_paragraph: Euro zone monthly retail sales fell in January for the third consecutive month, against market expectations of a rise, estimates released by Eurostat on Friday showed, in a sign of lower consumer appetite for spending as prices go up.

headline.main: Euro Zone January Retail Sales Unexpectedly Drop for Third Straight Month
headline.print_headline: Euro Zone January Retail Sales Unexpectedly Drop for Third Straight Month

docs.snippet: Euro zone monthly retail sales fell in January for the third consecutive month, against market expectations of a rise, estimates released by Eurostat on Friday showed, in a sign of lower consumer appetite for spending as prices go up....

docs.lead_paragraph: Saudi Arabia's King Salman has embraced the "selfie", taking part in a number of light-hearted self-shot pictures and videos during his tour of Asia that contrast with the pomp and formality of most of the octogenarian monarch's trips abroad.

headline.print_headline: Saudi King Salman Embraces 'Selfie' on Tour Across Asia

docs.lead_paragraph: A senator and detained critic of Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte's war on drugs has warned he and his "blind followers" will pay for ignoring alleged extrajudicial killings, and should stop trying to fool the world their crackdown was above board.

headline.main: Philippines' Duterte Will Pay Price for Drugs Killings, Detained Senator Says
headline.print_headline: Philippines' Duterte Will Pay Price for Drugs Killings, Detained Senator Says

docs.lead_paragraph: China is warning of "severe damage" to relations with India and increased regional instability if exiled Tibetan leader the Dalai Lama proceeds with a visit to a disputed area along their still-unsettled border.

headline.print_headline: China Says Dalai Lama Border Visit Would Damage India Ties

docs.lead_paragraph: India have learnt their lessons from the debacle in Pune and will not repeat the mistakes in the second test against Australia, captain Virat Kohli said on Friday.
